titleStmt.title: F. P. Stickley to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4326

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Gov Thomas. E. Bramlett
Frankfort Ky

Dr Sir Enclosed I send you a petition for George W Kinsor for the purpose of getting a fine remitted. I have been acquainted with Mr Kinsor for several years. I am satisfied that the statements in his petition are true, and I think him to be an honest industrious obedient citizen he has been living on the road leading to Cumberland Gap. and has suffered a good ^deal^ from the rebels, by them taking from him I dont think he means or intends to violate any of the laws knowingly. His petition as you will see is endorsed by all or nearly so of the officials of the County and by many prominent Union men of the County beliving that you will make that disposition of his case that should be done

I am Sir Respectfully
F. P. Stickley
Barbourville Ky
Oct 19 1863
